title: Dalex Finance announces tremendous growth in 2014
text:
22:06 CET Dalex Finance announces tremendous growth in 2014 By MyJoyOnline 
In spite of the economic challenges, Dalex Finance and Leasing Company recorded an increase in profit 2014 declaring it as their 'banner year for business'. 
Its salary loan disbursements grew by 65 percent and its Dalex Paddy sales workforce also doubled from 750 to over 1500 agents nationwide. 
The Chief Executive Officer of Dalex Finance, Kenneth Thompson announced this at the launch of this year’s Dalex Dash promotion in Accra to reward public worker loan clients free cash on loans they service. 
He said the company is offering GHÈ¼ 25,00 for a loan facility of GHÈ¼ 500- GHÈ¼ 1,000; GHÈ¼ 50.00 for GHÈ¼ 1,000- GHÈ¼ 4,000; GHÈ¼ 100 for GHÈ¼ 4000- GHÈ¼ 7,000; GHÈ¼ 250 for GHÈ¼ 7000- GHÈ¼ 10,000 and GHÈ¼ 500 for GHÈ¼ 10,000- GHÈ¼ 20,000 from July 16 to September 30, 2015. 
The Dalex CEO revealed that the company is rated 16th on Ghana’s Class 100, said from 2015-2017 the company wants to become a financial services group spanning corporate finance, private equity and small and medium scale finance and real estate finance. 
He said the company would in 2016 initiate a GHÈ¼ 1.00 micro investment product that would operate with a phone number and account number with services rendered through the commercial banks and mobile money. 
Mr. Thompson further indicated that DALEX was proud of its leading role in ethical sales practices in the Salary Loans Sector due to its partnership with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) Business Edge platform. 
“We continued our partnership with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) Business Edge program’, to ensure that our nationwide Dalex Paddy sales force continues to follow best practices. Your Dalex Paddy will advise you of the full cost of your loan whiles making sure that you only borrow what you can afford.” 
For his part, the Director of Operations at Dalex Finance, Joe Jackson commended the sales agents for the tremendous performance. 
He said Dalex Finance in 2014 disbursed 65 per cent loans to more than 21,000 public sector workers through a partnership with the Business Edge Programe of International Finance Corporation, bothering on the core ethical issues of Care, Honesty, Availability, Respect, Trust and Secrets. 
He also attributed the success chalked to their high premises especially in the rural and peri-urban areas in the country. 
Mr. Joe Jackson believes the sky is the limit for Dalex Finance despite to unstable economic conditions in the country. 
Story by Ghana/Joy Business
